snippet: British officials are trying to break the World War II-era code found on the remains of a carrier pigeon at a home in Surrey.
abstract: Memo from Europe; campaign by pigeon fans has prompted message attached to leg of World War II military carrier pigeon, whose skeletal remains were found in a chimney in Surrey in 1982, to be sent to Britain’s top-secret GCHQ listening post and decoding department outside London; authorities say they cannot reveal what is in message until  code is broken.
lead_paragraph: British officials are trying to break the World War II-era code found on the remains of a carrier pigeon at a home in Surrey.

headline.seo: World War II Pigeon’s Message a Mystery
headline.main: A Bird Skeleton, a Code and, Maybe, a Top Secret
headline.print_headline: A Bird Skeleton, a Code and, Maybe, a Top Secret
